_header: All that I in word and deed / I thank hit God all folks king

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Alle þat ich in word and dedeI þonke hit God al folkes
                    kyng…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þe Pope haþ granted hem to medeand
                    halred dawes to pardoun
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodRawPoe225.First Lines:
Al þat I can in word & dedeI thanke it god bothe lord
                    & kyng…
BodRawPoe225.Last Lines:
…þer myȝtte men sen bothe elde & ȝongeHe
                    þat was sek hol a n[ ]
BodRawPoe225.Note:
Ends imperfectly, the last folio is damaged; ‘b’ of folio
                    reference is not column designation.
BodRawPoe225.Editions:
Keller,  Carl. 
             Die mittelenglische Gregoriuslegende.
         Heidelberg: Winter; New York: Stechert, 1914.

NLS1921.First Lines:
…Þerl him graunted his wille ywis þat þe kniȝt
                    him hadde ytoldþe barouns þat were of miche pris bi forn him
                    þai weren y[ ]…
NLS1921.Last Lines:
…Þer ich him feterd fast & bond he me suffred & stille
                    lay& þe keye wiþ mi riȝt hond in to [ ] y cast
                    away
NLS1921.Note:
Lines 1-268 missing in this MS; begins imperfectly at line 269; ends
                    imperfectly. Lines correspond to 269-1330 of Vernon text. Long-line couplets or
                    quatrains, abab, written two verse lines to a line of MS.
NLS1921.Facsimiles:
Pearsall,  Derek,  and  I. C. Cunningham, eds.  
             The Auchinleck Manuscript. National Library of Scotland
                Advocates’ MS. 19.2.1.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.

Keller,  Carl. 
             Die mittelenglische Gregoriuslegende.
         Heidelberg: Winter; New York: Stechert, 1914. 
Turnbull,  William Barclay David Donald,
                        ed.  
             Legendae Catholicae.
         Edinburgh, 1840: 1-67.
Schulz,  Fritz. 
             Die Englische Gregorlegende.

Kendal.Note: Lines corresponding to 127-90, 572-653 of Vernon text.
